articles.author: Ritu Sharma
articles.title: 35 Years After Indian Troops Saved Maldivian Govt, ‘China-Pumped’ Male Asks Indian Military To Leave - EurAsian Times
articles.description: On November 3, 1988, the predawn silence in Male, the capital of the remote Indian Ocean Archipelago Maldives, was broken by the sound of machine guns, rockets, and grenades. The then-Maldivian President Maumoon Abdul Gayoom was the target of the deadly coup …
articles.content:

articles.author: Ashish Dangwal
articles.title: 1st Nation To Establish Lunar Base, US Says China Could ‘Outpace’ NASA In Race To Moon - EurAsian Times
articles.description: US intelligence has publicly expressed apprehensions about China potentially outpacing the United States in the race to send humans back to the moon and establish a lunar outpost, according to reports. Washington and Beijing are actively competing for an edge…
